text: 934832978 | CMC | 67874389 | | 047165 | 4/18/2002 12:00:00 AM | chest pain | | DIS | Admission Date: 9/13/2002 Report Status: Discharge Date: 4/25/2002 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** HANE , JR , BRENT 487-33-52-4 Lottetier Rd. Service: MED DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 2/26/02 AT 11:00 AM CONTINGENT UPON Not Applicable WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: TREDWAY , LLOYD JESSIE , M.D. DISPOSITION: Home DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: ECASA ( ASPIRIN ENTERIC COATED ) 325 MG PO QD ATENOLOL 50 MG PO QD HOLD IF: HR<50 , SBP<100 and call HO NITROGLYCERIN 1/150 ( 0.4 MG ) 1 TAB SL q5min x 3 PRN chest pain HOLD IF: SBP < 100 ZOCOR ( SIMVASTATIN ) 40 MG PO QHS Starting Today ( 8/14 ) Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Avoid grapefruit unless MD instructs otherwise. COZAAR ( LOSARTAN ) 50 MG PO QD Number of Doses Required ( approximate ): 10 LANTUS ( INSULIN GLARGINE ) 40 UNITS SC QAM DIET: House / ADA 2000 cals/day / Low saturated fat low cholesterol RETURN TO WORK: as tolerated FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Dr. Phil Armesto as needed , Dr. Benjamin Mander as needed , No Known Allergies ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: chest pain PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) chest pain OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay htn ( ) low back pain ( ) retinal vein occlusion ( ) s/p hernia repair ( ) benign familial leukopenia ( ) polyclonnal gammapathy syncopal episode '95 ( ) OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: none OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) cardiac cath 11/22 BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: Pt. is a 72y.o. man with known CAD s/p MI in 'oo with stents placed in PDA and RCA , IDDM , and HTN who presented to cardiologist for routine appt with c/o CP since 7am morning of admission. Pain described as "light" and worse when pushed on chest , felt it at rest and on exertion. History not totally consistent with angina but given cardiac history and pt is a diabetic , he was admitted for r/o MI. Cardiac enzymes and he has been pain free since arrival. EKG with new TWI/flattening in V5V6 , no other acute changes. Had ETT 4/24/02 which was c/w but not diagnostic of ischemia. Underwent cath on 11/22 which revealed non-obstructive CAD - 35% pLAD , 40% mid LAD , 50% pRCA , no intervention done. Patient stable post-cath without chest pain , d/c home on 2/16 . ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: Call your doctor if you develop chest pain or difficulty breathing. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: No dictated summary ENTERED BY: BASYE , EDGAR T. , M.D. , PH.D. ( FB39 ) 2/26/02 @ 10:20 AM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
